title: "Infiltrators' Presence Means PM, Nitish Kumar Failed": Asaduddin Owaisi To NDTV
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has snubbed the BJP's charge that the Opposition uses infiltrators as a vote bank,accusing the NDA combine in Bihar of defaming the Muslims after ignoring their progress.

title: Can't Be A 'Yes Man': Chirag Paswan To NDTV On Criticising Bihar Law And Order
content: The NDA is united in Bihar this time and will put up a record performance, LJP (Ram Vilas) chief and Union minister Chirag Paswan has said.

title: Migrant Workers, Youth Real X Factors Of Bihar Polls: Prashant Kishor
content: Jan Suraaj Party founder Prashant Kishor on Saturday claimed that migrant workers and the youth are the real "X factor" of the ongoing assembly elections in Bihar, and not the women.

title: "Should Be Probed": Sharad Pawar Breaks Silence On Grandnephew's Land Deal
content: Two days after the Pune land-grab allegations involving his grandnephew set off a political storm, NCP (Sharadchandra Pawar) chief Sharad Pawar broke his silence, saying the matter should be investigated fully.

title: Exclusive: Why Chirag Paswan Couldn't Contest From Bihar And His 2030 Plan
content: Does Chirag Paswan have chief ministerial ambitions? The Union minister and LJP (Ram Vilas) chief chose diplomacy to answer the question, trying to skirt around the domain that has been exclusive to Nitish Kumar.

title: Man Creates Ex-Employee's Fake Social Media After Salary Dispute, Arrested
content: The Delhi Police arrested a 37-year-old man for allegedly creating a fake social media account using his former employee's photograph to harass and defame her online after she demanded her pending salary from him, police said on Saturday.

title: Kids Can Grow Up But Should Be Obedient: BJP On Ajit Pawar's Land Scam Reply
content: The controversial land deal linked to Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar's son, Parth, has given a new handle to the NCP stalwart's traditional political rivals to target him over his response to allegations.

title: With PM Modi Inaugurating 4 New Vande Bharat Trains, Fleet Count At 164
content: Indian Railways now operates a total of 164 Vande Bharat Express train services across the country after Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday flagged off four new Vande Bharat trains from Varanasi, officials said.

title: Rapist, Criminals Seen Using Phones, Watching TV Inside Bengaluru Jail
content: A clip shows Reddy, who was convicted of raping 20 women and murdering 18 of them between 1996 to 2022, using two Android phones and one keypad mobile inside the jail.

title: Punjab Police Bust Drug Supply Module, Arrest 2 Pakistan-Backed Operatives
content: Police in Punjab's Amritsar busted two Pakistan-backed drug supply modules, arresting two key operatives in smuggling Methamphetamine.

title: Fake Airline Job Racket Busted In Delhi, Over 40 Victims Traced Nationwide
content: The accused were allegedly running an illegal call centre in West Delhi, posing as recruiters for reputed airlines.

title: SIR Forms Distributed On Bengal Streets, Complaint Filed With Poll Body
content: The Election Commission of India has received multiple complaints filed against Booth Level Officers (BLOs) by various political parties in West Bengal for distributing the enumeration forms for Special Intensive Revision (SIR) at public places.

title: Mother, 8-Year-Old Daughter Found Murdered At Rajasthan Home, Robbery Suspected
content: A 32-year-old woman and her eight-year-old daughter were found dead with severe injury marks on their bodies in their rented house in Kota's Rojadi area, officials said on Saturday.

title: Instagram User Charged Over Fake Clip Of DK Shivakumar Pushing Siddaramaiah

title: Big Win For Carnatic Cafe, Court Restrains Bengaluru Eatery From Using Tag

title: "Bhaiya Mat Karo": Woman In Bengaluru Says Rapido Rider Tried To Grab Her Legs

content: Trinamool Congress (TMC) MP Kalyan Banerjee on Saturday expressed concern over the rising incidents of cyber fraud, questioning how ordinary citizens could be protected if even public representatives like him could fall prey to such scams.

title: Kerala Woman Forced To Drink Alcohol, Smoke Beedi To "Evict Ghost From Body"

title: Inside Bengaluru jail: Rapist, criminals seen using phones, watching TV; probe on
content: Videos have emerged showing convicted serial rapist Umesh Reddy and terror case accused Tarun Raju using mobile phones and other privileges inside Bengaluru's Parappana Agrahara Central Jail. The Karnataka Prison Department has launched an investigation into how the inmates accessed the devices and if prison officials were complicit, with strict action promised if lapses are found.

title: Op Sindoor fallout: Spooked Pak army, Munir move to consolidate power; what is Art 243?
content: Pakistan is fortifying its military command structure by tabling a constitutional amendment, citing lessons from India tensions. The move aims to formally enshrine the ranks of service chiefs and potentially create a 'Commander of Defence Forces,' raising concerns about increased military power over civilian government.

title: 'No proof of Sita‚Äôs birthplace‚Äô: Congress digs up old BJP remark; demands PM's apology
content: Congress slammed PM Modi's Sitamarhi rally, citing a 2017 culture ministry statement denying historical proof of Goddess Sita's birth there. Jairam Ramesh demanded an apology, accusing the BJP of neglecting Bihar's religious sites and cancelling a key rail project. Meanwhile, Amit Shah announced an Rs 850-crore Sita temple project for the region.

title: Future of AI: 'I would have dropped out if...'; Nvidia CEO's message to Zuckerberg
content: Nvidia's Jensen Huang and Meta's Mark Zuckerberg shared insights on AI's future and building tech empires. Huang humorously wished he'd dropped out like Zuckerberg, while both acknowledged their long journeys and mutual admiration. Nvidia's remarkable rise to a $5 trillion valuation was highlighted, contrasting with Zuckerberg's own dorm-room beginnings leading to Meta's trillion-dollar status.

title: 'Fighting Mahatma's battle': Priyanka targets PM Modi; calls for 'change' in Bihar
content: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra stated that the Congress and Mahagathbandhan are fighting for citizens' rights and democracy, drawing parallels to Mahatma Gandhi's struggle against an 'empire of Narendra Modi.' She accused the BJP of attempting to weaken the Constitution and 'steal' votes, amid ongoing opposition claims of electoral manipulation.

title: Record! Jurel becomes 2nd India A batter to achieve this rare feat
content: Dhruv Jurel achieved a rare feat by scoring centuries in both innings of an 'A-Test' against South Africa A, becoming just the second Indian to do so. His composed 127* helped India A extend their lead significantly. Meanwhile, Rishabh Pant retired hurt but returned to play a brisk 65, easing fitness concerns ahead of the upcoming Test series.

title: Jensen Huang praises Musk: Nvidia CEO has a title for Tesla boss; calls him 'the ultimate GPU‚Äô
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang lauded Elon Musk as 'the ultimate GPU' for his ability to manage complex ventures like xAI's massive AI data center, Colossus II. Huang compared Musk's mind to a supercomputer, capable of processing intricate systems. This praise follows Musk's own admiration for Huang's 'hardcore' work ethic, highlighted in a resurfaced interview.

title: Gaza ceasefire: Khan Younis hospital receives 15 bodies from Israel; aid still delayed
content: Under the US-brokered ceasefire, Gaza's Nasser Hospital received 15 Palestinian bodies from Israel, following the return of an Israeli hostage's remains. This exchange adheres to an agreement where Israel returns 15 Palestinian bodies for each Israeli hostage released. The deal also mandates increased aid to Gaza, though a significant portion remains unadmitted.

title: Missed flight, cleared no gate: How British national slipped past Delhi immigration; hunt on
content: A British national, Fitz Patrick, allegedly bypassed immigration formalities at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport after arriving from Bangkok. He was discovered missing during routine checks, prompting an investigation into how he exited the terminal. Authorities are utilizing CCTV footage and intelligence to trace his whereabouts.

title: Delhi airport tech snag: Normalcy restored a day after 800+ flight delays; advisory issued
content: Operations at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport have returned to normal following a technical glitch in the Air Traffic Control's flight planning system. The issue, which affected the Automatic Message Switching System, led to widespread flight delays yesterday. Authorities are working to minimize passenger inconvenience.

title: Apple's CarPlay Ultra: Automakers in split with adoption; Ford CEO warns of overreach
content: Ford CEO Jim Farley expressed strong concerns about Apple's CarPlay Ultra, fearing it encroaches too deeply into vehicle control. He questioned how far Apple's brand should extend into car functions, emphasizing the digital experience as a key differentiator for future vehicles. This follows similar reservations from other automakers and GM's decision to drop both CarPlay and Android Auto.

title: China's war on global academic freedom: UK varsity halts study on Uyghurs
content: A UK university's temporary halt on Uyghur forced labour research, reportedly due to Chinese student market access fears, has sparked global debate on academic freedom. Sheffield Hallam University reversed its decision after backlash, but the incident highlights Beijing's growing leverage over institutions. This controversy coincides with intensified global Uyghur advocacy efforts.

title: 'My question was misunderstood': YouTuber apologises to actor Gouri Kishan after backlash
content: YouTuber R. S. Karthik apologized to actress Gouri Kishan. He faced criticism for asking about her weight at a film press conference. Kishan responded strongly, calling the question disrespectful. Many celebrities supported her stand. Karthik stated his question was misunderstood. The incident has reignited discussions on body-shaming and media conduct towards actresses.

title: Hong Kong Sixes: India crash out after losses to Kuwait, UAE & Nepal; Pak, Aus in semis
content: India's Hong Kong Sixes campaign ended in disappointment with three consecutive defeats, failing to advance from the main competition. Despite strong performances from Abhimanyu Mithun and Dinesh Karthik, India lost to Kuwait, UAE, and Nepal, crashing out of the tournament.

title: Being smart isn‚Äôt enough: Here‚Äôs how Bill Gates says students can truly thrive
content: Bill Gates, a Harvard dropout and education advocate, emphasizes that success transcends academic intelligence. He advises students to choose their peers wisely, surrounding themselves with those who challenge and inspire them. Furthermore, Gates stresses the importance of recognizing and appreciating diverse talents, acknowledging that a blend of skills, not just high IQ, is crucial for a richer life and career.

title: Former NBA star Delonte West‚Äôs Narcan revival highlights harsh post-career reality
content: Former NBA star Delonte West was found unconscious and not breathing in Virginia, requiring Narcan administration. He was later arrested for public intoxication and resisting arrest after refusing hospital transport. This incident follows previous legal troubles, including a trespassing charge last year, around the same time in Novmber 2024 highlighting his ongoing struggles post-basketball.

title: ‚ÄòKnew F-16s could deliver nukes‚Äô: Ex-CIA officer makes big claim on Pak
content: Former CIA officer Richard Barlow revealed that US Presidents certified Pakistan as a non-nuclear state until 1989, despite intelligence showing modified F-16s could deliver nuclear weapons.  Washington prioritized Pakistan's Afghan war cooperation over non-proliferation, even tipping off Islamabad about an operation to arrest a nuclear smuggler.

title: 'Don't you have mother, sister at home': Woman films molester inside bus in Kerala- video
content: A woman passenger on a KSRTC bus in Thiruvananthapuram confronted and slapped a co-passenger who was inappropriately touching her. The incident, recorded by the woman, led to the man's removal from the bus after the conductor intervened. No formal complaint has been filed yet.

title: Asia Cup row | 'Ice has been broken': BCCI secretary after meeting with Naqvi
content: BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia confirmed a productive meeting with PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi during the ICC Board meeting in Dubai, where the Asia Cup trophy row was informally discussed. Both cricket boards, with mediation from ICC officials, have agreed to resolve the issue amicably and at the earliest opportunity. This marks a significant step towards breaking the ice on the matter.

title: Robbery bid failed in Ahmedabad: Woman throws chilli powder at jeweller. How he responded
content: A dramatic robbery attempt at a Ranip jewellery shop ended in failure. A woman threw chilli powder at the owner to steal valuables. The powder missed its target. The shop owner reacted swiftly. He struck the woman multiple times before pushing her out. CCTV footage of the incident has gone viral. Police are searching for the woman and investigating further.

title: 'Mistakenly applied': LJP (RV) MP inked on both fingers after polls; admin responds
content: In response to concerns over potential voter fraud, the Patna administration confirmed that the ink marks seen on LJP MP Shambhavi Chaudhary's fingers were a result of an error made by polling staff, not an instance of double voting. The Presiding Officer promptly rectified the situation by marking her left hand instead.

title: Did Israeli lawyers warn of Gaza war crimes? What US intel found and why Biden admin was worried
content: US intelligence revealed Israeli military lawyers' internal warnings about potential war crimes in Gaza, fueled by US weapons. Despite public defenses, private doubts emerged.  The Biden administration delayed sharing this alarming assessment, deepening concerns over civilian targeting and aid obstruction, even as a UN inquiry found acts of genocide.

title: IND vs AUS: Why Tilak Varma is not playing the crucial 5th T20I - Explained
content: Suryakumar Yadav confirmed that Tilak Varma will play no part in the final T20I against Australia, with Rinku Singh returning to the playing XI. This decision reflects India's rotational approach ahead of the T20 World Cup, allowing players to be tested in different roles and combinations. A win will secure a series win for the visitors.

title: Candace Owens fires back at Ben Shapiro over claims about Erika and Charlie Kirk
content: Candace Owens vehemently denied accusing Erika Kirk of her husband Charlie Kirk's death, calling Ben Shapiro a liar for his claims on The Megyn Kelly Show. Owens stated Shapiro fabricated the accusation to discredit her. Meanwhile, Erika Kirk appealed for public grace following her husband's passing, emphasizing the impact of online discourse on her children.

title: Water timing that helps your kidneys: Why spaced sips beat late-night chugs
content: Your kidneys prefer steady hydration, not big gulps at night. Spacing small sips through the day supports filtration, prevents stones, and reduces night-time bathroom trips. Follow the ‚Äú2-hour rule‚Äù before sleep and simple timing habits.

title: ‚ÄúIt was only later that I discovered...‚Äù: US singer ‚Äòtricked‚Äô into marrying ex-Malaysian King
content: American singer Brittany Porter claims she was 'tricked' into marriage with the former King of Malaysia, Sultan Muhammad V, believing it was an engagement.  She now seeks a 'proper divorce' after the Sultan allegedly disappeared and she discovered he was still married to another woman. Porter is channeling her heartbreak into music.

title: Land deal case: Trouble for Pawar's son? Firm told to pay stamp duty of Rs 21cr with penalty
content: Authorities have demanded Rs 21 crore in stamp duty and penalty from Amadea Enterprises LLP for a cancelled 40-acre land deal in Mundhwa. The firm, co-partnered by Parth Pawar, had sought stamp duty exemption for a data centre project, but its cancellation has nullified the concession. The sub-registrar insists on full payment before re-submitting the cancellation deed.

title: Huge blow for IND! Rishabh Pant hit multiple times during match against SA; retires hurt - Video
content: Rishabh Pant suffered an injury scare during the 2nd India A Test match against South Africa A, retiring hurt after being struck multiple times by a South African pacer. The wicketkeeper-batter was hit on the helmet, elbow, and body, prompting medical attention and a concussion check. He then walked off the pitch accompanied by medical staff.

title: 'Mentally tortured': 30-year-old woman found dead; husband, 6 in-laws booked for murder
content: A 30-year-old woman was found dead under suspicious circumstances in Faridabad, with preliminary findings suggesting strangulation. Her mother has registered a murder case against her husband and six relatives, alleging continuous harassment and threats. The deceased had reportedly called her mother the day before her death, stating she was being troubled and threatened.

title: Candace Owens thanks Daily Wire after being fired as her podcast becomes world‚Äôs No. 1
content: Candace Owens states her podcast is now the world's number one show. She credits her firing from The Daily Wire for this success. Owens was dismissed in March 2024 after criticizing Israel's actions in Gaza. She believes the separation brought her significant publicity. Her new show is now topping global podcast charts.

title: Cricket at LA Olympics 2028: How teams will be picked; why no guarantee of India vs Pak
content: There could be a strong possibility of not seeing an India vs Pakistan contest at Los Angeles Olympics, as the details of the global qualifier are still unknown. In the detailed statement after the ICC Board meeting, the sport's global body mentioned the success of women's cricket and also shared an update on the LA28 Games.

title: Why Zarine Khan‚Äôs funeral followed Hindu rituals ‚Äî son Zayed fulfilled her last wish
content: Zarine Khan, wife of actor Sanjay Khan, passed away at 81. Her funeral was conducted according to Hindu rituals, as she was born Hindu and never converted to Islam. Her son Zayed Khan led the 'dah-sanskar', fulfilling her last wish.

title: What happens if you fall into a blackhole, spaghettification explained
content: Falling into a black hole means facing extreme stretching, known as spaghettification, due to immense tidal forces. While supermassive black holes might allow crossing the event horizon intact, destruction is inevitable near the singularity. Scientists study this process to test physics boundaries and understand cosmic events, revealing insights into gravity and information paradoxes.

title: 'Doobne ki practice‚Äô: PM Modi's veiled dig at Rahul's fishing bid; takes 'katta' jibe at oppn again
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi mocked Rahul Gandhi's fishing attempt and attacked the RJD's "Jungle Raj" legacy at a Bihar rally. He highlighted the NDA's development agenda, contrasting it with the RJD's alleged promotion of crime and corruption among youth, urging voters to choose progress over the past.

title: Rajinikanth‚Äôs brother suffers heart attack; superstar rushes to Bengaluru
content: Superstar Rajinikanth's elder brother, Sathyanarayana Rao Gaikwad, 84, has been hospitalized in Bengaluru after suffering a heart attack. The actor immediately rushed from Chennai to be by his brother's side, who is currently in the ICU.  Fans are sending prayers for his speedy recovery as he remains under medical observation.

title: Connectivity boost: PM Modi flags off four new Vande Bharat trains; check time-table
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has launched four new Vande Bharat Express trains, enhancing rail travel across key Indian routes. These modern, high-speed trains will connect Bengaluru-Ernakulam, Varanasi-Khajuraho, Lucknow Junction-Saharanpur, and Firozpur Cantt-Delhi.

title: Top rainforests on Earth and why they‚Äôre essential for our planet‚Äôs survival
content: Earth's vital rainforests, crucial for oxygen production and climate regulation, face severe threats from deforestation and human activities.  From the Amazon to the Congo and Southeast Asia, these biodiversity hotspots are home to unique species and indigenous communities.  Urgent conservation is needed to protect these invaluable natural treasures from ongoing destruction.

title: 'Like a table fan': Ex-IND batter's brutal take on Gill; praises 'storm' Abhishek
content: India eyes an overseas T20I series win against Australia, with opener Shubman Gill under scrutiny. While Abhishek provides explosive starts, Gill's inconsistent form is a concern. Former batter Sadagoppan Ramesh likened their dynamic to a "storm and a table fan," emphasizing the crucial role of the opening partnership in setting formidable totals.

title: Rising air pollution: Tharoor takes 'Delhi injurious to health' dig; shares old post
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has pointed out Delhi-NCR's ongoing air pollution crisis. He shared a six-year-old social media post that remains relevant today. Since Diwali, the national capital's air quality has been poor to severe. The Air Quality Index is high, with many areas reporting very poor conditions. Shallow fog is also expected, reducing visibility.

title: ‚ÄòNo one visited this Diwali‚Äô: Family of Muskan Rastogi puts house on sale; plans to leave Meerut
content: Facing social boycott and painful memories after their daughter's alleged involvement in a sensational murder case, the Rastogi family has put their Meerut residence up for sale. The family's jewellery business has collapsed, and they are ostracized by the community, leading to their decision to leave the city.

title: ‚ÄòImmigrant could become public charge‚Äô: Getting a US visa may get harder for many ‚Äì who's affected?
content: A new Trump administration directive instructs consular officers to consider applicants' health conditions and ability to afford treatment when determining visa eligibility. This move expands the 'public charge' rule, potentially impacting individuals with chronic illnesses and raising concerns about discrimination and arbitrary decisions.

title: Body language expert decodes Shah Rukh Khan‚Äôs ‚Äòalpha gesture‚Äô
content: Body language expert Kaanan Tandi analyzed Shah Rukh Khan's 'alpha gesture,' noting his confident 'cowboy cross' posture. However, Tandi highlighted Khan's awareness in adjusting his body language, particularly by avoiding this pose when in the presence of women or respected seniors, demonstrating consideration and respect.

title: Expert picks, best bets: How Randy Brown could get an upset win at UFC Fight Night
content: welterweight title fight tops next week's UFC 322 fight card . Neither Brown nor Bonfim are ranked in the MMA divisional rankings . the first of two consecutive weeks of main events takes place on saturday .

title: Don't be surprised if ... Lamar Jackson, Rashid Shaheed thrive down the stretch
content: Rashid Shaheed averaged 11.6 fantasy points, on pace for 83 receptions and 943 receiving yards . Shaheed was a reasonable, deep-league flex option who simply needed better quarterback play . he averaged an ordinary 11.3 yards per catch with QBs Spencer Rattler .

title: Major storm set to hit circuit
content: a storm appears set to hit the Interlagos Formula 1 circuit ahead of the sprint race . forecasters predict heavy rain and high winds in the morning . a delay to the race could have an impact on the start time of the one-hour qualifying session .

title: Why was Ja Morant suspended? What we know about the latest Grizzlies drama
content: grizzlies guard Ja Morant is frustrated with his joy for the game of basketball . the Grizzlies are frustrated, too, suspending Morant for a game over the weekend because of conduct detrimental to the team . morant missed the loss to the Toronto Raptors on Sunday, then had 18 points .

title: NHL Power Rankings: Every team's current pace vs. preseason projections
content: a panel of ESPN hockey commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on the games through Wednesday . this edition of the Power Rankings will be taking a look at the preseason over/under point totals compared to each team's current points pace .

title: Last-minute pickups for Week 10: What will it take for Darnold to get more love?
content: every Friday throughout the 2025 season, Matt Bowen will offer some late-week pickup options to fill those holes . this column will focus mostly on players rostered in fewer than 50% of ESPN leagues, with occasional exceptions .

content: the blackout affects ABC, the ESPN networks, the Disney-branded channels, Freeform, the FX networks and the Xfinity network . the conflict affects the channel's ability to carry Disney programming . if you don't have cable access, you can get instant access to ESPN content through a variety of services including Cox, Dish, DirecTV, Fios, Fubo, Hulu + Live TV, Mediacom, Optimum, Sling, Spectrum TV and

title: Rankings, contract projections for top 50 MLB free agents
content: the free agency offseason kicks off at 5 p.m. ET on friday . it's time to rank the 2025-26 free agent class and predict how much money each player will get . the goal is to predict what will happen, not decide what each player is worth .
